definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: B shaved head also helped her stay cool in Egypts stifling heat.
sentences.chinese: 剃秃顶发也能让她在埃及使人梗塞的很热衷连结风凉。

sentences.english: His head was bald, with the exception of two graying tufts of hair that arced behind his ears.
sentences.chinese: 秃顶，只在耳后有一圈灰白头发。

sentences.english: Julius Caesar wore a laurel wreath because he was going bald.
sentences.chinese: 凯撒大帝戴一顶月桂花冠是因为他快要秃顶了。

sentences.english: Male caribou start to grow antlers every spring; a transformation from bald to bedecked.
sentences.chinese: 雄驯鹿每年春天开始长角，从秃顶到过分装饰的转换。

sentences.english: The bos'n's mate was a heavy man, bald, with a scarred and brutal face.
sentences.chinese: 这个水手长助手是个秃顶，面带伤疤和凶相的大力士。

sentences.english: A bald Jew is kissing Madame Bovary?
sentences.chinese: 一个秃顶的犹太人亲包法利夫人？

sentences.english: He had observed all around him how blond men went bald first .
sentences.chinese: 他注意到周围金发的男人总是先秃顶。

sentences.english: Men who are going bald often wear baseball caps.
sentences.chinese: 秃顶的男人通常会带棒球帽。

sentences.english: Jill couldn't resist makeing jokes about his baldness.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔忍不住拿他的秃顶开玩笑。

definition: baldness/to lose hair or feathers/to molt/depilation
to be balding/to be thinning on top
beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit
